intro: Valeriana hornschuchiana, commonly known as the hornschuchian valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically oval and serrated, with a strong, aromatic scent. Valeriana hornschuchiana is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
